intro: Corema scoparium, commonly known as the narrowleaf corema, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and showy, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators. Corema scoparium is often found in wetlands and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
